files.description: Project overview with quickstart commands and a description of the included toy-model experiments and expected outputs.
Python project configuration specifying dependencies, optional extras, and tool settings for reproducible runs.
Package initializer for the experiment suite exposing the public experiment registry interface.
Experiment registry and CLI-discoverable metadata that standardizes inputs/outputs across simulations and symbolic derivations.
Shared utilities for RNG seeding, result saving, table formatting, and cached diagnostic computations used by all experiments.
Quantum/classical diagnostics including entanglement entropy, mutual information, correlators, and decoherence metrics for small systems.
Toy lattice/graph model showing emergence of classicality via system-environment coupling with plots/tables of decoherence and entanglement.
Symbolic derivations and numerical evaluation of a simple renormalization-group flow (e.g., phi^4 beta-function toy) with reproducible plots.
Small-scale random circuit simulation illustrating entanglement growth and saturation with example outputs and saved figures.
Centralized plotting helpers that produce consistent, publication-style figures and save them deterministically to the output directory.
Single entry-point CLI to list and run experiments, manage output directories, and generate example plots and tables reproducibly.

missionDescription: Implement prototype numerical / symbolic experiments that illustrate the behavior or consequences of the most promising candidate framework(s). This may include: toy-model simulations, symbolic derivations (e.g., effective action, renormalization flow), entanglement structure diagnostics, or small-scale lattice/graph models demonstrating emergence of classicality from quantum rules. Produce reproducible code and example outputs (plots, tables).
missionSuccessCriteria: 1) Repository (runtime/outputs/simulations/) with runnable notebooks or scripts demonstrating at least one toy-model behavior relevant to the proposed unifying idea; 2) Figures (PNG) and a short README describing how to reproduce results and interpret outputs.
